issue.body:
## Type of change

<!-- (mark with an `X`) -->

```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature development
- [x] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [x] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective

<!--Describe what the purpose of this PR is. For example: what bug you're fixing or what new feature you're adding-->

Configure renovate to tag dependencies with the relevant team.

- Removed `npm minor` to decrease the review burden.

## Before you submit

- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team
- Ensure that all UI additions follow [WCAG AA requirements](https://contributing.bitwarden.com/contributing/accessibility/)

pull_request.title: [PM-4395] Block reseller org invites if they outnumber available seats
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

<!-- (mark with an `X`) -->

```
- [X] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature development
- [ ] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective

<!--Describe what the purpose of this PR is. For example: what bug you're fixing or what new feature you're adding-->

[PM-4395](https://bitwarden.atlassian.net/browse/PM-4395)

This PR blocks reseller-managed organization owners/admins from inviting new members to their organization if:

1. Their current number of confirmed members matches the number of available seats
2. Their current number of confirmed members is lower than the number of available seats, but they try to invite a number of new members at once that outnumbers their remaining seats

## Code changes

<!--Explain the changes you've made to each file or major component. This should help the reviewer understand your changes-->
<!--Also refer to any related changes or PRs in other repositories-->

- **messages.json:** Add a split and combined version of the new error message. Split is for the Toast title/body and the combined is for the form validation error.
- **people.component.ts:** Show a Toast when user tries to invite a new member while the reseller-managed org's seat count already equals the number of confirmed members.
- **member-dialog.component.ts:** Show an email validation error when the number of new members the user tries to invite outnumbers the available seats for the reseller-managed org.

## Screenshots

<!--Required for any UI changes. Delete if not applicable-->

https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/assets/144709477/11b61d7d-78f7-48a5-a1d6-7c90f8b64ce5

## Before you submit

- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team
- Ensure that all UI additions follow [WCAG AA requirements](https://contributing.bitwarden.com/contributing/accessibility/)


[PM-4395]: https://bitwarden.atlassian.net/browse/PM-4395?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

pull_request.title: [PM-3036] Implement Autofill Overlay Unlock State
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [x] New feature development
- [ ] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective

This PR represents the bulk of the work necessary to have a secure autofill overlay implemented within the browser extension. I've tried to scope down the work on this ticket to some degree by implementing a single feature of the autofill overlay, the unlock vault view that appears in the overlay when the user focuses a form field.

## Code changes

- **apps/browser/gulpfile.js:** Adding a step when bundling the extension that removes the unsupported `sandbox` attribute from the manifest.json. We are still setting the page iframes to have a `sandbox` attribute when generating the overlay page, but Firefox does not support the same CSP policy as Chrome does.
- **apps/browser/src/_locales/en/messages.json** All translations required for the new overlay content UI elements
- &&apps/browser/src/auth/popup/utils/** Modifications to how the auth popup appears to facilitate presentation of the unlock window without a notification prompt when the user is trigger the unlock from the overlay
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/background/** The code changes in this directory represent the bulk of the logic required for querying data from the background script when displaying the overlay. The changes in the notification background class facilitate skipping presentation of the notification bar while still a subsequent action once the user unlocks the extension
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/constants.ts:** Adding constants to represent more events that are triggered by the overlay
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/content/** Changes within the scope of this folder represent modifications to how we facilitate initializing the autofill overlay as well as the core autofill logic. We have incorporated two bootstrapping scripts that allow users to conditionally load the logic required for the autofill overlay.
-  **apps/browser/src/autofill/jest/autofill-mocks.ts:** Expanding the set of mock methods that facilitate mocking autofill related data
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/jest/testing-utils.ts:** Expanding the testing utilities used within the jest tests for autofill related behavior
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/jest/typings.ts:** Adding a jest typing that is used in several autofill jest test files
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/notification/bar.scss:** Making small modifications to the notification bar styles to facilitate sharing the `variables.scss` file between it and the autofill overlay
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/overlay/abstractions/:** Typing information for the various classes used to present the overlay to the end user
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/overlay/iframe-content/:** The changes within the scope of this directory represent the logic required to inject the custom HTML elements used to wrap the overlay iframe pages in a closed ShadowDOM. They also represent the singular communication point between the sandboxed iframe pages and the background script of the extension
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/overlay/pages/button/:** The changes within the scope of this directory represent the logic required for presentation of the overlay button page and its behavior.
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/overlay/pages/list/:** The changes within the scope of this directory represent the logic required for presentation of the overlay list page and its behavior.
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/overlay/pages/shared/:** The changes in the scope of this directory represent shared logic between the overlay list and button pages
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/services/:** The changes in the scope of this directory represent the core overlay content script behavior, which is injected dynamically by the autofill service. It also represents changes to the collect page details content script and insert autofill content script behavior.
- **apps/browser/src/autofill/utils/:** The changes in the scope of this directory represent utility methods and typing information used within the scope of the autofill feature.
- **apps/browser/src/background/main.background.ts:** Adding the OverlayBackground as a dependency and facilitating initialization of its logic
- **apps/browser/src/background/runtime.background.ts:** Adding a call to verify that the overlay feature flag is set when triggering the autofill script inject
- **apps/browser/src/manifest.json:** Updating the manifest file to facilitate the required assets for showing the overlay list and button pages.
- **apps/browser/src/manifest.v3.json:** Updating the manifest file to facilitate the required assets for showing the overlay list and button pages.
- **apps/browser/src/platform/browser/browser-api.ts:** Removing an unnecessary param from the `getUILanguage` method call
- **apps/browser/src/platform/listeners/on-command-listener.ts:** Removing an unnecessary param from the `getUILanguage` method call
- **apps/browser/src/platform/listeners/update-badge.ts:** Removing an unnecessary param from the `getUILanguage` method call
- **apps/browser/src/popup/services/services.module.ts:** Removing an unnecessary param from the `getUILanguage` method call
- **apps/browser/src/safari/desktop.xcodeproj/project.pbxproj** Updating the xcode manifest for app extensions to facilitate incorporating the overlay assets within the extension build for safari
- **apps/browser/test.setup.ts:** Updating the chrome API structure to facilitate testing for the autofill overlay feature
- **apps/browser/webpack.config.js:** Incorporating Webpack logic required to bundle the Overlay page assets for both the list and button elements
- **libs/angular/src/vault/components/icon.component.ts:** Updating the icon component to remove duplication for how we capture the website icon information. A new class `WebsiteIconService` has been created and is used by both the overlay background and this modification component.
- **libs/common/src/services/website-icon.service.ts:** Migrating logic from the vault icon component to allow the overlay background to use the same logic for identifying the website icon, this is shown in the overlay list
- **package.json** Adding two dependencies to this project. The first one, `@webcomponents/custom-elements` acts as a polyfill for the custom elements that we use within the extension pages. This is required, as support within the context of an extension page JS runtime is not consistent between all browsers. The second one, `tabbable`, allows us to easily identify the tabbable elements within a page. This is used when keyboard focus is leaving the overlay list or overlay button. We either need to create our own method for this, or use something like this dependency. 

## Screenshots


https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/assets/16629865/2d531b5f-200c-4ae0-b9f4-f3e204f3691f

issue.title: Safari: password reprompt window stays open when tabs are pinned
issue.body:
### Steps To Reproduce

1. Pin tabs in Safari
2. Lock the vault of the browser extension
3. Hit Shift-Command-L, enter PIN / Password


### Expected Result

The vault should be unlocked, and the little popup window where you entered the password should close.

### Actual Result

The popup window stays open in the background.

### Screenshots or Videos

_No response_

### Additional Context

It works as intended when there are no pinned tabs. However, when tabs are pinned, the popup window for the password prompt only moves to the background instead of being closed.

This is particularly annoying when you have a short timeout on the vault, as it will create a new window every time you use autofill and put in the password. Even worse is using biometrics, as each of the windows in the background tries to request the fingerprint all the time.

### Operating System

macOS

### Operating System Version

Sonoma 14.0

### Web Browser

Safari

### Browser Version

Version 17.0 (19616.1.27.211.1)

### Build Version

2023.9.1

### Issue Tracking Info

- [X] I understand that work is tracked outside of Github. A PR will be linked to this issue should one be opened to address it, but Bitwarden doesn't use fields like "assigned", "milestone", or "project" to track progress.

comment.body:
Hi there,

I am unable to reproduce this issue, it has been escalated for further investigation. If you have more information that can help us, please add it below. 

Thanks!

pull_request.title: AC-1333 vault report org ciphers
pull_request.body:
```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ X ] New feature development
- [ ] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective

The reports pages should show the user any ciphers from an organization they were invited to and have `Can Edit` access to that collection. 

They should not be seeing any `Can View` items.

Added the `app-org-badge` to the reports with `disabled=true`. They are not yet clickable, reports badge flow will come in a future ticket. 

## Code changes

- filtering of `Can Edit` ciphers done in `app/reports` ts files with `.filter((c) => c.edit);`
- `app/reports` pages brought in `OrganizationService` to subscribe to organizations for `app-org-badge` logic
- files in `admin-console/organizations/tools` were updated to have services sent to parent class
- html files in `app/reports` given the `app-org-badge` component
- spec files added for each reports page
- created a `reports-ciphers.mock` for reusable mock data between specs

## Video of Can View ciphers not being listed and removed from count

https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/assets/8302660/e1fede26-3166-43a2-b4bc-2cfb467e7029

Additional Video showing consistent ciphers between reports and org reports as well as the badge hidden on org reports


https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/assets/8302660/6ae37be6-00df-416d-8c70-f5d14602dd43

issue.title: Firefox plugin opens browser side panel (sidebar) on vault lock
issue.body:
My Firefox side panel defaults to this plugin.
Since last update (or so), everytime the vault is being locked (either manually or thanks to the auto lock feature) it will open the side panel by itself to display the plugin.

It happens a couple seconds after lock, even if I didn't use the side panel during this session.
It doesn't happen if side panel is set to display something else (bookmarks, history...)

When it happens the red padlock disappears briefly from the plugin icon, like when the vault is unlocked (even if side panel is not set to display Bitwarden)

Bug encountered on Windows and Linux.

Steps to reproduce:

- Log in, either throught plugin's widget (not sure if it's the right word) or side panel
- Lock vault (and close side panel if you manipulated the vault through it)
- Wait for around 7 seconds

issue.title: Firefox plugin opens browser side panel (sidebar) on vault lock
issue.body:
My Firefox side panel defaults to this plugin.
Since last update (or so), everytime the vault is being locked (either manually or thanks to the auto lock feature) it will open the side panel by itself to display the plugin.

It happens a couple seconds after lock, even if I didn't use the side panel during this session.
It doesn't happen if side panel is set to display something else (bookmarks, history...)

When it happens the red padlock disappears briefly from the plugin icon, like when the vault is unlocked (even if side panel is not set to display Bitwarden)

Bug encountered on Windows and Linux.

Steps to reproduce:

- Log in, either throught plugin's widget (not sure if it's the right word) or side panel
- Lock vault (and close side panel if you manipulated the vault through it)
- Wait for around 7 seconds

comment.body:
Hello,

We've thoroughly investigated this issue across multiple platforms, including macOS, Windows, and Linux, and have been unable to reproduce it. 

If you're still experiencing this problem after performing a clean installation of the browser extension by removing any leftover data ([instructions here](https://bitwarden.com/help/data-storage/#on-your-local-machine)), you can also try refreshing your Firefox profile using [Mozilla's instructions](https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/refresh-firefox-reset-add-ons-and-settings).

If your issue persists, please don't hesitate to reach out to us through our [contact form](https://bitwarden.com/contact/), so we can continue troubleshooting.

The issue will remain closed.

Thank you!

issue.title: [macOS] app not loading
issue.body: ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Click on bitwarden app to open ### Expected Result App open and shows list of all saved passwords ### Actual Result Spinning wheel of death. ### Screenshots or Videos _No response_ ### Additional Context _No response_ ### Operating System macOS ### Operating System Version 14.0 (23A344) ### Installation method Mac App Store ### Build Version Version 2023.9.3 (12828) ### Issue Tracking Info - [X] I understand that work is tracked outside of Github. A PR will be linked to this issue should one be opened to address it, but Bitwarden doesn't use fields like "assigned", "milestone", or "project" to track progress.

comment.body:
I can confirm this issue.
I also can confirm that the issue was persistent with the previous version of the Bitwarden App (2023.9.1).

The Edge Plugin works fine on macOS Sonoma.

issue.title: punycode module deprecated message
issue.body:
### Steps To Reproduce

from terminal on macOS, run any `bw` command:

bw --version

### Expected Result

should only provide the version:

2023.9.1

### Actual Result

shows a deprecation warning for punycode in node:

(node:2299) [DEP0040] DeprecationWarning: The `punycode` module is deprecated. Please use a userland alternative instead.
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)
2023.9.1

### Screenshots or Videos

❯ bw --version
(node:2299) [DEP0040] DeprecationWarning: The `punycode` module is deprecated. Please use a userland alternative instead.
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)
2023.9.1

### Additional Context

_No response_

### Operating System

macOS

### Operating System Version

14.0 (23A344)

### Shell

Zsh

### Build Version

2023.9.1

### Issue Tracking Info

- [X] I understand that work is tracked outside of Github. A PR will be linked to this issue should one be opened to address it, but Bitwarden doesn't use fields like "assigned", "milestone", or "project" to track progress.

comment.body:
Hi there,

Thank you for your report! 

I was able to reproduce this issue, and I have flagged this to our engineering team.

If you wish to add any further information/screenshots/recordings etc., please feel free to do so at any time - our engineering team will be happy to review these.

Thanks once again!

issue.title: Todays monthly update fails on Windows Hello authentification popup
issue.body:
### Steps To Reproduce

Program start

### Expected Result

Popup Window Fingerprint for me

### Actual Result

nothing

### Screenshots or Videos

nothing to see

### Additional Context

every couple month the same mess after monthly update 

### Operating System

Windows

### Operating System Version

22H2

### Installation method

Direct Download (from bitwarden.com)

### Build Version

2023.8.2

### Issue Tracking Info

- [X] I understand that work is tracked outside of Github. A PR will be linked to this issue should one be opened to address it, but Bitwarden doesn't use fields like "assigned", "milestone", or "project" to track progress.

comment.body:
> Did you mean to post this? (It looks like a re-post of your message a week ago) 

He answered a question I posted and deleted, realizing I didn't need the answer.
